author: .paulharris
content: https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/381 anyone against adding sync committee pool for completeness?

author: tersec
content: I'm against the rationalization for it.

author: tersec
content: Is there, in fact, a use case?

author: .paulharris
content: i dont have any strong use case other than completeness, which was pretty much what was roughly stated in the pr iirc

author: .paulharris
content: im not sure anyone has ever said 'i wish we could get the sync committee pool', at least i've never heard it heh

author: dapplion
content: Unless there's a performance concern I don't see why we should skip simple routes serving existing data. Not everyone wanting to potentially consume this API will have the knowledge and interest of coming to some channel and publicly asking for it.

author: radekkapka
content: I am indifferent to this. It is trivial to implement, so not a big deal if we include it and help some users with their queries.

author: tersec
content: I reject this framing of this involving "skipping" anything. It doesn't exist now. Its default status in that regard is nonexistence. There's plenty of data and state which CLs maintain which there's no particularly standardized or widespread Beacon APIs for, nor necessarily in all cases is there a strong argument for there to be. Furthermore, my question was not, has someone come to this channel and publicly asked for it, it's, is there a use case?

author: jameshe5018
content: for other client teams  `/eth/v1/beacon/states/{state_id}/validators/{validator_id}`, if the validator is inactive do you throw a 400 error?

author: sproul
content: no, 404 because the request is not invalid

author: sproul
content: we should clarify this in the spec though
